intro: Perezia ciliosa, commonly known as the silky perezia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Perezia ciliosa is often grown as an ornamental plant for its delicate foliage and subtle floral display.
